text:
Hello everyone, we use an HTML onlick event with a function. When i click on the element i get the error:

> â€œUncaught ReferenceError: filterSelection is not defined
The element is inside the HTML & HubL Block of a module. The JS-function is inside the module.js of the same module. When i put the JavaScript Code into an external file and link it with the module then the function is working. Does anyone know what the problem is with this solution? The script of the module.js and the external JavaScript are loaded at the same place (below the HTML-Code).

```<li class="btn active" onclick="filterSelection('all')"> All</li>```

Hey all, i am new in HubSpot and i have an issue loading the js files in my templates. is there any guideline on how can i do this? i am loading the scripts in the footer, and i can see that the files are loaded but the js is not working as it should. Any ideas?
Can you share some screenshot how you did this ??
i thought it was the minifying of the jquery files but after fixing that i still have issues with the js working properly
